intro: Elwendia cabulica, commonly known as the Persian bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in rocky or alpine environments. Elwendia cabulica is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens for its delicate floral display.
